chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Enters speedy trial demand. Court sets for trial as requested.

3:09 PM (64-06) Defendant Vernal S Harding in court via video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Herrmann. Attorney Selmek in court for and with Vernal Harding.
State called to the stand as a witness, Police Officer Hayden Beecroft from Whitewater.
Hayden Beecroft duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
3:12 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Selmek.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann requesting bind over.
Argument by Attorney Selmek, objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Victim appeared in court and made a statement, requesting no contact be lifted on bond.
State is requesting 3 weeks for Arraignment Hearing. 

Bond Motion - Attorney Herrmann objects to modifying bond.
Attorney Selmek is requesting a Bond Hearing next week.
Court will leave bond as is.
Bond Hearing set 04-01-2022 at 1:15 PM

Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vernal Scott Harding appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek for bond purposes only. Called at 1:19 pm. Defendant does qualify for SPD's office. Bond set from yesterday to include these charges. Matter remains on for tomorrow at 1:15. Minutes filed.
Order to seal notice of arrest
Updated NOA with additional charge

*AMENDMENT 7-13-2022: MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH J.N.B. WHILE DEFENDANT IS IN CUSTODY. 

**AMENDMENT 04-14-2022 -  ADDED CONDITION:  NO CONTACT WITH E.M.W. (1-31-2006)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.N.B. (dob 5-26-1980) OR S.J.V. (dob 6-20-1981) OR THEIR RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1275 thru 22-1277, 22-1285
